sections.heading: Donations inter vivos; definitionA donation inter vivos is a contract by which a person, called the donor, gratuitously divests himself, at present and irrevocably, of the thing given in favor of another, called the donee, who accepts it
sections.text: Amended by Acts 1871, No. 87; Acts 2008, No. 204, ยง1, eff. Jan
